parameters.name: targets
parameters.description: Targets to build. May be rules or files.

parameters.name: --dryrun
parameters.description: Do not execute anything, and display what would bedone. If you have a very large workflow, use --dryrun --quiet to just print a summary of the DAG of jobs.

parameters.name: --profile
parameters.description: Name of profile to use for configuring Snakemake. Snakemake will search for a corresponding folder in /etc/xdg/snakemake and /headless/.config/snakemake. Alternatively, this can be an absolute or relative path. The profile folder has to contain a file 'config.yaml'. This file can be used to set default values for command line options in YAML format. For example, '--cluster qsub' becomes 'cluster: qsub' in the YAML file. Profiles can be obtained from https://github.com/snakemake-profiles.

parameters.name: --snakefile
parameters.description: The workflow definition in a snakefile.

parameters.name: --cores
parameters.description: Use at most N cores in parallel (default: 1). If N is omitted, the limit is set to the number of available cores.

parameters.name: --local-cores
parameters.description: In cluster mode, use at most N cores of the host machine in parallel (default: number of CPU cores of the host). The cores are used to execute local rules. This option is ignored when not in cluster mode.

parameters.name: --cores
parameters.description: Preserve specific environment variable when running CommandLineTools. May be provided multiple times.

parameters.name: Preserve all env variable
parameters.description: Preserve all environment variable when running CommandLineTools.

parameters.name: Delete Docker container
parameters.description: Delete Docker container used by jobs after they exit (default)

parameters.name: Do not delete Docker
parameters.description: Do not delete Docker container used by jobs after they exit
